item.title: tidytuesday I'm gonna be...
item.description: I’ve been having some days! Between sick kids, myself getting sick, deadlines and development promises, I haven’t had a lot of time to make any kind of blog post…

item.title: #TidyTuesday: The Sad Story
item.description: This weeks #TidyTuesday is all about global mortality rates. I’ve looked at datasets like this before, and while they are a great way to see interesting trends and practise some visualization skills, I think there is another lesson to be learned. The human element of data. These data were people. They meant something to someone…

item.title: #TidyTuesday
item.description: I do not update this site as much as I would like. Interacting through twitter and the #R4DS slack channel has been my main contributions as of late to being more active in the #rstats community. I make plans to get to things like posting, then end up with other work, a neat idea, or just decide spend time with my family…

item.title: Second star to the right and straight on 'til morning
item.description: The strength of R doesn’t lie in a single programming paradigm, it lies within the warm, welcoming and ecclectic community of useRs. Like anyone who gets introduced to R, you start to look on the web for other like minded people…

item.title: CEEA Reflections
item.description: Yes, I get it. I don’t post often enough…

item.title: 52Vis - Homeless
item.description: I’ve a confession to make. I’m a terrible blogger. I do so out of need and interest, and I’ve a lot of the latter but little of the former. “The game has changed.” Clu (Yes, Tron Returns. Get over it…

item.title: Goofus and Gallant: Charts
item.description: For the past couple of years I’ve been delving into the world of information visualization. Part due to intense interest, part due to job responsibilities…

item.title: IVMOOC Reflections
item.description: So IVMOOC has been over for quite some time now. Looking back on the experience, I consider it to be a personal success…

item.title: #IVMOOC Week 7
item.description: Due to the nature of this week in the course, I’ve created my visualization and reflection using R, shinyapps.io and various wonderful packages…

item.title: I don't have a clever title
item.description: I’m in Boston, in the middle of training for marking of the Critical Thinking Assessment Test. The training is good, and their process is solid. Put that on top of a decent reliable and valid instrument and you’ve got something. I’ll need to see the results and the data to draw more conclusions, but so far I like it. Anyways.…

item.title: My business is with R tonight, with maps and color. #IVMOOC Week 5
item.description: So the midterm has me a bit disheartened. Not because of difficulty, but because of the miscommunication between the admin and the students. In Canvas the midterm description was set to Feb 16th 8pm EST deadline. After putting my son to bed, and while making dinner, I logged into Canvas and rushed to do the midterm…

item.title: I'll take 'Famous Titles' for $400 Alex. #IVMOOC Week 4
item.description: Two posts in week, and two weeks of #IVMOOC down! Topical analysis this week, and keeping in theme, here’s what I’m…

item.title: Where in the world is Carmen Sandiego?
item.description: Getting through this week was a bit tough, not due to content or complexity, but due to life, work and winter. Being the only well parent is a lot of work. Couple that with deadlines, grant writing and research sessions made for very little free time…

item.title: #IVMOOC Week 2
item.description: I’m liking this course. The videos are easy to listen to and are in nice manageable chunks that I can watch them while making dinner, or on a quick break from work…

item.title: #IVMOOC Week 1
item.description: So I’ve made it through the first week of #IVMOOC. Gold stars all around! I did learn some new things, new tricks and new tools from the lectures and I’m a sucker for a good framework…

item.title: Are you still there?
item.description: Sometimes a simple pause leads to a time-out. Juggling parenthood, my normal hatrack of jobs, plus teaching put way to many demands on my time to devote it to #dalmooc, despite it being a very interesting experience…

item.title: Pressing pause
item.description: Dear #Dalmooc, Unfortunately, I have to press pause for some time on my learning to tackle deadlines, wrap up teaching and evaluate my students and my teaching. Hopefully I’ll be able to catch up before the deadlines for the early competencies. We now return you to your regularly scheduled program, already in progress.…

item.title: Of data and questions
item.description: This post was for the 2nd week of #DALMOOC A concept/process mash up of a map…

item.title: Barriers & Analytics
item.description: This post is addressing the first assignment/question for #DALMOOC Analytics use at this organization is largely focused on academic analytics, using the results of assessment of student learning to inform course, program and curriculum…

item.title: Affectively effective
item.description: I’d like to consider myself as a self-directed, life-long learner. Rather, I would now after undergrad, grad school with a plethora of job related learning thrown in. I didn’t start that way, I had to learn…
